filteredArticles.headline: Pennsylvania extends stay-at-home order until at least May 8 to curb spread of virus
filteredArticles.abstract: The original order, issued on April 1, mandated that all residents stay home and practice social distancing, and all nonessential businesses shut down until April 30.

filteredArticles.headline: Phila. Mayor Jim Kenney urges Trump to provide more emergency funding to cities
filteredArticles.abstract: Kenney wrote the city is incurring “extraordinary expenditures” while also facing significant declines in tax revenue as businesses remain closed during Philadelphia’s stay-at-home order.

filteredArticles.headline: Pennsylvania under stay-at-home order until April 30 to stop spread of coronavirus

filteredArticles.headline: Philadelphia unable to use local hospital for coronavirus patients due to steep rent cost
filteredArticles.abstract: Hahnemann University Hospital closed in September 2019 when owner Joel Freedman requested the city $1 million a month for rent. The hospital will remain closed and unable to treat coronavirus patients.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Hahnemann University Hospital.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Although Hahnemann University Hospital is empty, the City of Philadelphia cannot afford the almost $1 million monthly cost to buy or lease it. (Photo by Scott McLeod | CC BY 2.0)

filteredArticles.headline: Philadelphia reports first coronavirus-related death

filteredArticles.headline: Fresh Grocer to shut down in March following four-year legal battle with Penn

filteredArticles.headline: Trump gives student scholarship to fight 'failing' schools – but she attends Phila. charter
filteredArticles.abstract: President Donald Trump awarded a scholarship to Philadelphia schoolgirl Janiyah Davis to promote school choice, condemning "failing government schools." But Davis attends one of the best charter schools in the city.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn trustee nominated by Pa. governor to financial cabinet position

filteredArticles.headline: Widespread asbestos in Phila. public schools prompts health concerns
filteredArticles.abstract: Six Philadelphia public schools and an early learning center have closed since September due to hazardous asbestos damage, and numerous Penn students who attended these schools are worried about their health.

filteredArticles.headline: Here’s what you should know about Philadelphia’s Nov. 5 election
filteredArticles.abstract: Along with City Council races, Philadelphia residents will elect a mayor, sheriff, city commissioner, and will vote in several judicial races and on three ballot questions about Philadelphia and Pennsylvania policies.

dominantMedia.title: Philadelphia elections November 2019
dominantMedia.content: The city will be debuting new touch-screen voting machines, replacing machines which have been used since the 1990s.
